tool.name: aurora_deseq2
tool.description: Differential analysis of count data with the DESeq2 package
tool.command:
######### each aurora tool generates a html file and have an files path directory associated with it. mkdir -p $report.files_path &&
######### three important paths: ######### 1. path to tool installation directory ######### 2. path to report html ######### 3. path to files_path directory associated with the report output. export TOOL_INSTALL_DIR='${__tool_directory__}' && export REPORT='$report' && export REPORT_FILES_PATH='$report.files_path' &&
############ create a hidden file to store r markdown rendering log touch $report.files_path/r_rendering.log.txt &&
############ finally run the render.R script Rscript '${__tool_directory__}/rmarkdown_report_render.R'
-o $report -d $report.files_path -A '$count_data' -B '$column_data' -C '$design_formula' -D '$treatment_name' -E '$treated' -F '$untreated' -T '$test_method' -H '$fit_type' -I '$alpha' -J '$significant_genes'

param.name: count_data
param.label: Count data
param.help: The first column is sample names; The remaining columns are read counts from each sample.

param.name: column_data
param.label: Column data
param.help: The first column are sample names (column name from the count data); The remaining columns are experimental treatments.

param.name: design_formula
param.label: Design formula
param.help: The design formula expresses the variables which will be used in modeling. The formula should be a tilde (~) followed by the variables with plus signs between them, e.g., ~ condition1 + condition2

param.name: treatment_name
param.label: Treatment name
param.help: one of the treatment column names from the column data.

param.name: treated
param.label: Treated
param.help: A level from the specified treatment column that will be used as the treated group in the DESeq2 analysis.

param.name: untreated
param.label: Untreated
param.help: A level from the specified treatment column that will be used as the untreated group in the DESeq2 analysis.

param.name: test_method
param.label: Test method
param.help: either 'Wald' or 'LRT', which will then use either Wald significance tests (defined by nbinomWaldTest), or the likelihood ratio test on the difference in deviance between a full and reduced model formula (defined by nbinomLRT)

param.name: fit_type
param.label: Fitting of dispersions
param.help: either "parametric", "local", or "mean" for the type of fitting of dispersions to the mean intensity

param.name: alpha
param.label: Alpha
param.help: the significance cutoff used for optimizing the independent filtering (by default 0.1). If the adjusted p-value cutoff (FDR) will be a value other than 0.1, alpha should be set to that value.
